titleStmt.title: The merry deuill of Edmonton As it hath beene sundry times acted, by his Maiesties Seruants, at the Globe, on the banke-side.
titleStmt.author: Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616, attributed name.
Dekker, Thomas, ca. 1572-1632, attributed name.
Heywood, Thomas, d. 1641, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Henry Ballard for Arthur Iohnson, dwelling at the signe of the white-horse in Paules Church yard, ouer against the great north doore of Paules,

notesStmt.note: Sometimes attributed to William Shakespeare, to Thomas Dekker, to Thomas Heywood, and to others.
Based on the life of Peter Fabell.
Not the same work as "The life and death of the merry devill of Edmonton", a pamphlet by Thomas Brewer.
The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Corner cut out of upper right corner of title page, allowing part of headpiece to show through.

place.placeName: the signe of the white-horse in Paules Church yard, ouer against the great north doore of Paules
